They said: "You are no more than human beings like us! You wish to turn us away from what our fathers used to worship. Then bring us a clear authority."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Their messengers said: Can there be doubt concerning Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He calleth you that He may forgive you your sins and reprieve you unto an appointed term. They said: Ye are but mortals like us, who would fain turn us away from what our fathers used to worship. Then bring some clear warrant.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Their apostles said, ‘Is there any doubt about Allah, the originator of the heavens and the earth?! He calls you to forgive you a part of your sins, and grants you respite until a specified time.’ They said, ‘You are nothing but humans like us who desire to bar us from what our fathers used to worship. So bring us a manifest authority.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Their Messengers said: 'Is there any doubt about Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you to Him in order that He forgives you your sins and defers you till a stated term' They said: 'You are only mortals like us. You wish to bar us from that which our fathers worshipped. Give us some clear proof.'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Their messengers said, "Can there be doubt about Allah, Creator of the heavens and earth? He invites you that He may forgive you of your sins, and He delays your death for a specified term." They said, "You are not but men like us who wish to avert us from what our fathers were worshipping. So bring us a clear authority."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Messengers asked them, "Could there be any doubt about the existence of God who has created the heavens and the earth? He calls you to Himself to forgive your sins. He gives you respite only until the appointed time." They said, "You are mere mortals like us. What you want is to prevent us from worshipping that which our fathers worshipped. Show us clear proof (if what you say is true)."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Their apostles said: Is there doubt about Allah, the Maker of the heavens and the earth? He invites you to forgive you your faults and to respite you till an appointed term. They said: You are nothing but mortals like us; you wish to turn us away from what our fathers used to worship; bring us therefore some clear authority.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qalat rusuluhum afee Allahi shakkun fatiri alssamawati waalardi yadAAookum liyaghfira lakum min thunoobikum wayuakhkhirakum ila ajalin musamman qaloo in antum illa basharun mithluna tureedoona an tasuddoona AAamma kana yaAAbudu abaona fatoona bisultanin mubeenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Their messengers said, "Is there any doubt about God, the Originator of the heavens and earth? He calls you to Him in order to forgive you some of your offences and to reprieve you for a specific period." They said, "You are only human beings like ourselves! You want to divert us from what our forefathers have been worshipping, so bring us some clear authority."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Their messengers said: "Is there a doubt about Allah, The Creator of the heavens and the earth? It is He Who invites you, in order that He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a term appointed!" They said: "Ah! ye are no more than human, like ourselves! Ye wish to turn us away from the (gods) our fathers used to worship: then bring us some clear authority."

verses.text: قَالَتْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ رُسُلُهُمْ‌ إِنْ‌ نَحْنُ‌ إِلاَّ بَشَرٌ مِثْلُکُمْ‌ وَ لٰکِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ يَمُنُ‌ عَلَى‌ مَنْ‌ يَشَاءُ مِنْ‌ عِبَادِهِ‌ وَ مَا کَانَ‌ لَنَا أَنْ‌ نَأْتِيَکُمْ‌ بِسُلْطَانٍ‌ إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ وَ عَلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ فَلْيَتَوَکَّلِ‌ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پیامبرانشان به آنان گفتند: یقینی است که ما بشری مانند شما هستیم، ولی خدا به هر کس از بندگانش که بخواهد [با عطا کردن مقام نبوّت] منّت می نهد و ما را نسزد که جز به اجازه خدا معجزه ای برای شما بیاوریم، و باید مؤمنان فقط بر خدا توکل کنند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پيامبرانشان گفتند: ما جز مردمانى همانند شما نيستيم ولى خدا بر هر يك از بندگانش كه بخواهد منت نهد. ما را نسزد كه براى شما دليلى، جز به فرمان خدا، بياوريم و مؤمنان بر خدا توكّل كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پيامبرانشان به آنها گفتند: ما جز بشرى مثل شما نيستيم، ولى خدا بر هر كه از بندگانش بخواهد منّت مى‌نهد [و مقام رسالت مى‌دهد]، و ما را نرسد كه جز به اذن خدا براى شما معجزه‌اى بياوريم، و مؤمنان بايد بر خدا توكل كنند و بس

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پيامبرانشان به آنان گفتند: «ما جز بشرى مثل شما نيستيم. ولى خدا بر هر يك از بندگانش كه بخواهد منّت مى‌نهد، و ما را نرسد كه جز به اذن خدا براى شما حجّتى بياوريم، و مؤمنان بايد تنها بر خدا توكل كنند.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: رسولان باز به کافران پاسخ دادند که آری ما هم مانند شما بشری بیش نیستیم لیکن خدا بر هر کس از بندگان که بخواهد (به نعمت بزرگ نبوت) منّت می‌گذارد، و ما را نرسد که برای شما آیت و معجزی الاّ به اذن و دستور خدا بیاوریم، و مؤمنان (در هر حال) باید تنها به خدا توکل کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پیغمبرانشان بدیشان گفتند: (همان گونه که گفتید) ما جز انسانهایی همچون شما نیستیم، و لیکن خداوند بر هرکس از بندگانش که بخواهد منّت می‌نهد (و او را با لطف خود می‌نوازد و پیغمبرش می‌سازد) و ما را نسزد که دلیلی برایتان بیاوریم (و معجزه‌ای به شما بنمائیم) مگر با اجازه‌ی خدا (و توفیق او). و مؤمنان باید به خدا توکّل کنند و بس (و ما هم در برابر دشمنانگی شما بدو توکّل می‌کنیم). [[«یَمُنُّ»: منت می‌نهد. لطف و بزرگواری می‌کند. «مَا کَانَ لَنَا»: ما را نرسد. ما نمی‌توانیم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پیامبرانشان به ایشان گفتند [آری‌] ما جز انسانهایی مانند شما نیستیم، ولی خداوند بر هرکس از بندگانش که بخواهد منت می‌نهد [و نعمت می‌دهد] و ما را نرسد که جز به اذن الهی برای شما برهانی بیاوریم و مؤمنان باید که بر خداوند توکل کنند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پیامبرانشان به آنها گفتند: «درست است که ما بشری همانند شما هستیم، ولی خداوند بر هر کس از بندگانش بخواهد (و شایسته بداند)، نعمت می‌بخشد (و مقام رسالت عطا می‌کند)! و ما هرگز نمی‌توانیم معجزه‌ای جز بفرمان خدا بیاوریم! (و از تهدیدهای شما نمی‌هراسیم؛) افراد باایمان باید تنها بر خدا توکّل کنند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت بدیشان فرستادگان ایشان نیستیم ما جز بشری همانند شما و لیکن خدا منّت نهد بر هرکه خواهد از بندگان خویش و نرسد ما را که بیاریمتان فرمانروائیی مگر به اذن خدا و بر خدا پس باید توکّل کنند مؤمنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پيامبرانشان به آنها گفتند: ما جز آدميانى مانند شما نيستيم و ليكن خدا بر هر كه از بندگان خويش بخواهد [به نعمت نبوت‌] منت مى‌نهد. و ما را نسزد كه شما را حجتى آريم جز به خواست و فرمان خدا پس مؤمنان بايد بر خدا توكل كنند و بس.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پیامبرانشان برایشان گفتند: «ما جز بشری همانند شما نیستیم، ولی خدا بر هر یک از بندگانش که بخواهد منت می‌نهد. و ما را هیچ‌گاه نبوده است که جز به اذن خدا برای شما حجتی سلطه‌گر بیاوریم. و مؤمنان باید تنها بر خدا توکل کنند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Their apostles said to them: "Indeed we are men like you, but God bestows His favours on whomsoever He wills among His creatures. It is not in our power to bring a miracle for you without the leave of God. The believers should only place their trust in God.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Their Noble Messengers said to them, “We are indeed human beings like you, but Allah bestows favour upon whomever He wills, among His bondmen*; it is not our task to bring any proof to you except by the command of Allah; and only upon Allah must the Muslims rely.” (* Therefore Prophets and other men are not equal in status.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Their Messengers said to them, 'We are nothing but mortals, like you; but God is gracious unto whomsoever He will of His servants. It is not for us to bring you an authority save by the leave of God; and in God let the believers put all their trust.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Their apostles said unto them: we are naught but human beings like but Allah bestoweth favour on you, of His bond whomsoever He willeth and it is not for us to bring you a men command of warrantv except by the Allah. On Allah then let the believers rely.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Their Messengers said to them: "We are no more than human beings like you, but Allah bestows His Grace to whom He wills of His slaves. It is not ours to bring you an authority (proof) except by the Permission of Allah. And in Allah (Alone) let the believers put their trust.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Their messengers said to them, “We are only humans like you, but God favors whomever He wills from among His servants. We cannot possibly show you any proof, except by leave of God. In God let the faithful put their trust.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Their Messengers told them: "Indeed we are only human beings like yourselves, but Allah bestows His favour on those of His servants whom He wills. It does not lie in our power to produce any authority except by the leave of Allah. It is in Allah that the believers should put their trust.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Their Messengers said to them: "We are no more than human beings like you, but Allah bestows His grace to whom He wills of His servants. It is not ours to bring you an authority (proof) except by the permission of Allah. And in Allah (alone) let the believers put their trust."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Their messengers said unto them: We are but mortals like you, but Allah giveth grace unto whom He will of His slaves. It is not ours to bring you a warrant unless by the permission of Allah. In Allah let believers put their trust!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Their apostles said to them, ‘Indeed we are just human beings like yourselves; but Allah favours whomever of His servants that He wishes. We may not bring you an authority except by Allah’s leave, and in Allah let all the faithful put their trust.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Their Messengers said to them: 'We are nothing except humans like you. But Allah bestows His Mercy on those of His worshipers whom He chooses. We cannot give you proof, except with the permission of Allah. In Allah, let believers put their trust.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Their messengers said to them, "We are only men like you, but Allah confers favor upon whom He wills of His servants. It has never been for us to bring you evidence except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Messengers replied, "We are certainly mere mortals like you, but God bestows His favors on whichever of His servants He wants. We can not bring you authority without the permission of God. The faithful should trust in God alone.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Their apostles said to them: We are nothing but mortals like yourselves, but Allah bestows (His) favors on whom He pleases of His servants, and it is not for us that we should bring you an authority except by Allah's permission; and on Allah should the believers rely.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qalat lahum rusuluhum in nahnu illa basharun mithlukum walakinna Allaha yamunnu AAala man yashao min AAibadihi wama kana lana an natiyakum bisultanin illa biithni Allahi waAAala Allahi falyatawakkali almuminoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Their messengers replied, "We are indeed mortals like yourselves. But God bestows His grace on such of His servants as He chooses. We cannot give you miracles, except by God's leave. In God let true believers put their trust --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Their messengers said to them: "True, we are human like yourselves, but Allah doth grant His grace to such of his servants as He pleases. It is not for us to bring you an authority except as Allah permits. And on Allah let all men of faith put their trust.

verses.text: وَ مَا لَنَا أَلاَّ نَتَوَکَّلَ‌ عَلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ وَ قَدْ هَدَانَا سُبُلَنَا وَ لَنَصْبِرَنَ‌ عَلَى‌ مَا آذَيْتُمُونَا وَ عَلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ فَلْيَتَوَکَّلِ‌ الْمُتَوَکِّلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما را چه عذر و بهانه ای است که بر خدا توکل نکنیم، در حالی که ما را به راه هایِ [خوشبختی و سعادت] مان هدایت کرد، و قطعاً بر آزاری که [در راه دعوت به توحید] از ناحیه شما به ما می رسد، شکیبایی می ورزیم، پس باید توکل کنندگان فقط بر خدا توکل کنند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چرا بر خدا توكل نكنيم، و حال آنكه او راه ما را به ما بنمود؟ و ما بر آزارى كه به ما مى‌رسانيد صبر خواهيم كرد و توكل‌كنندگان بر خدا توكل كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چرا بر خدا توكل نكنيم و حال آن كه ما را به راه‌هايمان رهبرى كرده است؟ و ما بر آزارى كه به ما رسانديد البته صبر خواهيم كرد، و اهل توكل بايد تنها بر خدا توكل كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چرا بر خدا توكل نكنيم و حال آنكه ما را به راه‌هايمان رهبرى كرده است؟ و البته ما بر آزارى كه به ما رسانديد شكيبايى خواهيم كرد، و توكل‌كنندگان بايد تنها بر خدا توكل كنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و چرا ما بر خدا توکل نکنیم در صورتی که خدا ما را به راه راستمان هدایت فرموده؟ و البته (در راه اطاعت و رضای خدا) بر آزار و ستمهای شما صبر خواهیم کرد، و ارباب توکل باید (در همه حال خوش و ناخوش) تنها بر خدا توکل کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آخر چرا نباید به خدا توکّل کنیم، و حال آن که او ما را به راهمان رهنمود کرده است؟ (راهی که خودش آن را پدید آورده است و همگان را به پیمودن آن دعوت فرموده است و آئین الهیش نام داده است. ما بر توکّل خود می‌افزائیم) و حتماً بر اذیّت و آزارتان شکیبائی می‌نمائیم، و متوکّلان باید بر خدا توکّل کنند و بس. [[«مَا لَنَا»: ما را چه شده است؟ ما را چه رسیده است؟ «هَدَانَا سُبُلَنَا»: ما را به راههای خود داشته است و رهنمودمان کرده است و طریق نجات از دوزخ و وصول به بهشت را به ما نموده است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما را نرسد که بر خداوند توکل نکنیم، و حال آنکه ما را به راه درستمان هدایت کرده است، و بر آزاری که به ما می‌دهید، شکیبایی خواهیم کرد، و اهل توکل باید که بر خداوند توکل کنند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و چرا بر خدا توکّل نکنیم، با اینکه ما را به راه‌های (سعادت) رهبری کرده است؟! و ما بطور مسلّم در برابر آزارهای شما صبر خواهیم کرد (و دست از رسالت خویش بر نمی‌داریم)! و توکّل‌کنندگان، باید فقط بر خدا توکّل کنند!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و چه شود ما را توکّل نکنیم بر خدا حالی که به راستی هدایت کرده است ما را به راه‌های ما و همانا شکیبا شویم بر آنچه ما را بیازرده‌اید و بر خدا پس باید توکّل کنند توکل‌کنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ما را چيست كه بر خدا توكل نكنيم و حال آنكه او راه‌هاى [راست‌] ما را به ما بنمود و ما بى‌گمان بر آزارى كه به ما مى‌كنيد شكيبايى خواهيم كرد پس توكل كنندگان بايد بر خدا توكل كنند و بس.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و ما را چیست که بر خدا توکل نکنیم، حال آنکه به راستی ما را به راه‌های راهوارمان رهبری کرده است‌؟ و البته ما بر آزاری که به ما رساندید باید شکیبایی کنیم، و توکل‌کنندگان باید تنها بر خدا توکل کنند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And why should we not repose our trust in God when He has shown us our paths of duty to Him? We shall bear with fortitude the hardships you inflict upon us. The trusting place their trust in God."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And what is the matter with us that we should not rely on Allah? He has in fact shown us our ways; and we will surely be patient upon the troubles you cause us; and those who trust must rely only upon Allah.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And why should we not put our trust in God, seeing that He has guided us in our ways? We will surely endure patiently, whatever you hurt us; and in God let all put their trust who put their trust.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And wherefore should we not rely on Allah when He hath surely guided us our ways! And surely we shall bear patiently that with which ye afflict us and in Allah then let the trustful put their trust.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And why should we not put our trust in Allah while He indeed has guided us our ways. And we shall certainly bear with patience all the hurt you may cause us, and in Allah (Alone) let those who trust, put their trust."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “And why should we not trust in God, when He has guided us in our ways? We will persevere in the face of your persecution. And upon God the reliant should rely.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And why should we not put our trust in Allah when it is indeed He Who has guided us to the ways of our life? We shall surely continue to remain steadfast in face of your persecution. All those who have to put trust, should put their trust only in Allah."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And why should we not put our trust in Allah while He indeed has guided us in our ways And we shall certainly bear with patience all the hurt you may cause us, and in Allah (alone) let those who trust, put their trust."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: How should we not put our trust in Allah when He hath shown us our ways? We surely will endure the hurt ye do us. In Allah let the trusting put their trust.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And why should we not put our trust in Allah, seeing that He has guided us in our ways? Surely, we will put up patiently with whatever torment you may inflict upon us, and in Allah let all the trusting put their trust.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And why should we not put our trust in Allah, when He has already guided us to our Paths? We will endure your hurt patiently. In Allah, let all who trust place their trust'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And why should we not rely upon Allah while He has guided us to our [good] ways. And we will surely be patient against whatever harm you should cause us. And upon Allah let those who would rely [indeed] rely."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Why should we not trust in God when He has shown us the right way? We shall exercise patience against the troubles with which you afflict us. Whoever needs a trustee should trust in God."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And what reason have we that we should not rely on Allah? And He has indeed guided us in our ways; and certainly we would bear with patience your persecution of us; and on Allah should the reliant rely.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama lana alla natawakkala AAala Allahi waqad hadana subulana walanasbiranna AAala ma athaytumoona waAAala Allahi falyatawakkali almutawakkiloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and why should we not put our trust in God when He has already guided us to our paths? We will, surely, bear with patience all the harm you do us. So in God let those who trust put their trust."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "No reason have we why we should not put our trust on Allah. Indeed He Has guided us to the Ways we (follow). We shall certainly bear with patience all the hurt you may cause us. For those who put their trust should put their trust on Allah."

verses.text: وَ قَالَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا لِرُسُلِهِمْ‌ لَنُخْرِجَنَّکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ أَرْضِنَا أَوْ لَتَعُودُنَ‌ فِي‌ مِلَّتِنَا فَأَوْحَى‌ إِلَيْهِمْ‌ رَبُّهُمْ‌ لَنُهْلِکَنَ‌ الظَّالِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ولی کفرپیشگان به پیامبرانشان گفتند: مسلماً ما شما را از سرزمین خود بیرون خواهیم کرد، مگر اینکه هم کیش ما شوید. پس پروردگارشان به آنان وحی کرد: ما قطعاً ستمکاران را نابود می کنیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كافران به پيامبرانشان گفتند: يا شما را از سرزمين خود مى‌رانيم يا به كيش ما بازگرديد. پس پروردگارشان به پيامبران وحى كرد كه: ستمكاران را هلاك خواهيم كرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و كسانى كه كافر شدند، به پيامبرانشان گفتند: [يا] شما را از سرزمين خود بيرون مى‌كنيم، يا به كيش ما باز مى‌گرديد. پس پروردگارشان به آنها وحى كرد كه حتما ستمگران را هلاك خواهيم كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و كسانى كه كافر شدند، به پيامبرانشان گفتند: «شما را از سرزمين خودمان بيرون خواهيم كرد مگر اينكه به كيش ما بازگرديد.» پس پروردگارشان به آنان وحى كرد كه حتماً ستمگران را هلاك خواهيم كرد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز کافران به رسولان پاسخ دادند که ما البته شما را از شهر و دیار خود بیرون می‌کنیم مگر آنکه به آیین ما برگردید، در این حال (که رسولان مأیوس از ایمان کافران شدند) خدا به آنها وحی فرمود که (غم مخورید) البته ما ستمکاران را هلاک خواهیم کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کافران (و سردستگان زندقه و ضلال، هنگامی که از راه دلیل با انبیاء برنیامدند، به زور متوسّل شدند و) به پیغمبران خود گفتند: یا به آئین ما باز می‌گردید یا این که شما را از سرزمین خود بیرون می‌کنیم. پس پروردگارشان به آنان (که حاملان رسالات آسمانی و راهنمایان بشری بودند) پیام فرستاد که حتماً ستمکاران (کفرپیشه‌ی چون ایشان) را (به خاطر ظلم و ستمی که روا می‌دارند) نابود می‌کنیم. [[«لَتَعُودُنَّ»: برمی‌گردید. مراد پیغمبران و پیروان ایشان است (نگا: اعراف / 88). این تعبیر از باب تغلیب است و پیغمبران به همراه پیروان خود - که سابقاً مشرک بوده‌اند - دعوت شده‌اند که به بت‌پرستی برگردند. یا این که سکوت پیش از رسالت و مأموریّت تبلیغ پیغمبران، مشرکان را بر آن داشته است که پندارند پیغمبران قبلاً هم‌کیش ایشان بوده‌اند. «مِلَّة»: دین. آئین.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و کافران به پیامبرانشان گفتند یقینا شما را از سرزمینمان آواره می‌کنیم، مگر آنکه به آیین ما باز گردید، و پروردگارشان به آنان وحی کرد که ستمکاران را نابود خواهیم کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (ولی) کافران به پیامبران خود گفتند: «ما قطعاً شما را از سرزمین خود بیرون خواهیم کرد، مگر اینکه به آیین ما بازگردید!» در این حال، پروردگارشان به آنها وحی فرستاد که: «ما ظالمان را هلاک می‌کنیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفتند آنان که کفر ورزیدند به پیمبران خود همانا برون رانیم شما را از سرزمین خود یا که بازگردید در کیش ما پس وحی کرد بسوی ایشان پروردگارشان که البته هلاک کنیم ستمگران را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و كسانى كه كافر شدند به پيامبرانشان گفتند: هر آينه شما را از سرزمينمان بيرون مى‌كنيم يا به كيش ما باز گرديد. پس پروردگارشان به آنان وحى كرد كه البته ستمكاران را هلاك مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (تمامی) کسانی که (در تاریخ رسالت‌ها) کافر شدند، به (تمامی‌) پیامبرانشان گفتند: «شما را از سرزمین خودمان بی‌چون (و) بی‌گمان بیرون می‌کنیم، یا (اینکه) به‌راستی و یقین به کیش ما باز گردید.» پس پروردگارشان به آنان وحی کرد: «بی‌امان ستمگران را بس هلاک خواهیم کرد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The unbelievers said to their apostles: "We shall drive you out of our land, or else you come back to our fold." Their Lord then communicated to them: "We shall annihilate these wicked people,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And the disbelievers said to their Noble Messengers, “We will surely expel you from our land, unless you accept our religion”; so their Lord sent them the divine revelation that, “Indeed We will destroy these unjust people.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: The unbelievers said to their Messengers, 'We will assuredly expel you from our land, or you will surely return into our creed.' Then did their Lord reveal unto them: 'We will surely destroy the evildoers,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And those who disbelieved said to their apostles: we will surely drive you forth from our land, or else ye will have to return to our faith. Then their Lord Revealed unto them: We will surely destroy the wrong-doers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And those who disbelieved, said to their Messengers: "Surely, we shall drive you out of our land, or you shall return to our religion." So their Lord inspired them: "Truly, We shall destroy the Zalimun (polytheists, disbelievers and wrong-doers.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those who disbelieved said to their messengers, “We will expel you from our land, unless you return to our religion.” And their Lord inspired them: “We will destroy the wrongdoers.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then the unbelievers told their Messengers: "You will have to return to the fold of our faith or else we shall banish you from our land." Thereupon their Lord revealed to them: "We will most certainly destroy these wrong-doers,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And those who disbelieved, said to their Messengers: "Surely, we shall drive you out of our land, or you shall return to our religion." So their Lord revealed to them: "Truly, We shall destroy the wrongdoers."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And those who disbelieved said unto their messengers: Verily we will drive you out from our land, unless ye return to our religion. Then their Lord inspired them, (saying): Verily we shall destroy the wrong-doers,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But the faithless said to their apostles, ‘Surely we will expel you from our land, or you shall revert to our creed.’ Thereat their Lord revealed to them: ‘We will surely destroy the wrongdoers,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Those who disbelieved said to their Messengers: 'Return to our faith or we will banish you from our land' But Allah revealed to them: 'We shall destroy the harmdoers

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will surely drive you out of our land, or you must return to our religion." So their Lord inspired to them, "We will surely destroy the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The disbelievers told the Messengers, "We shall expel you from our land unless you revert to our religion." Their Lord then sent them (the messengers) a revelation, "We have decided to destroy the unjust

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And those who disbelieved said to their apostles: We will most certainly drive you forth from our land, or else you shall come back into our religion. So their Lord revealed to them: Most certainly We will destroy the unjust.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqala allatheena kafaroo lirusulihim lanukhrijannakum min ardina aw lataAAoodunna fee millatina faawha ilayhim rabbuhum lanuhlikanna alththalimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Those who deny the truth said to their messengers, "We shall banish you from our land unless you return to our ways." But their Lord inspired the messengers, saying, "We shall destroy the evil-doers,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And the Unbelievers said to their messengers: "Be sure we shall drive you out of our land, or ye shall return to our religion." But their Lord inspired (this Message) to them: "Verily We shall cause the wrong-doers to perish!

verses.text: وَ لَنُسْکِنَنَّکُمُ‌ الْأَرْضَ‌ مِنْ‌ بَعْدِهِمْ‌ ذٰلِکَ‌ لِمَنْ‌ خَافَ‌ مَقَامِي‌ وَ خَافَ‌ وَعِيدِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و یقیناً شما را پس از آنان در آن سرزمین ساکن خواهیم کرد. این [لطف و رحمت] ویژه کسی است که از مقام من بترسد، و از تهدید [به عذابم] بیم داشته باشد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و شما را پس از ايشان در آن سرزمين جاى خواهيم داد. اين از آن كسى است كه از ايستادن در پيشگاه من و از وعده عذاب من بترسد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و قطعا شما را پس از ايشان در [آن‌] سرزمين اسكان خواهيم داد. اين براى كسى است كه از مقام من بترسد و از تهديدم بيمناك باشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قطعاً شما را پس از ايشان در آن سرزمين سكونت خواهيم داد. اين براى كسى است كه از ايستادن [در محشر به هنگام حساب‌] در پيشگاه من بترسد و از تهديدم بيم داشته باشد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و محققا ما شما رسولان (و پیروانتان) را در سرزمین کافران پس از هلاک آنها (با آسایش و ایمنی) ساکن می‌گردانیم و این (آسایش) نصیب کسی است که از مقام من خائف است و از وعده قهر و عقاب من می‌ترسد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و ما شما را پس از ایشان در سرزمین (آنان) سکونت می‌بخشیم. این (پیروزی) از آن کسانی است که از جاه و جلال من بترسند و از تهدید من بهراسند. [[«ذلِکَ»: آن. در اینجا مراد (این) است که پیروزی پیغمبران و خداپرستان بر کافران و مشرکان است (نگا: صافّات / 171 - 173). «مَقَام»: جایگاه و پایگاه. مصدر میمی و به معنی قِیام، یعنی نظارت و مراقبت. روز قیامت که همگان در حضور اقدس او گرد می‌آیند و مورد بازرسی و بازپرسی قرار می‌گیرند. می‌تواند کنایه از ذات پروردگار هم باشد (نگا: رحمن / 46).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و پس از آنان شما را در این سرزمین سکنا می‌دهیم، این برای کسی است که از ایستادن [در محشر به هنگام حساب‌] در پیشگاه من بترسد، و از هشدار من بهراسد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و شما را بعد از آنان در زمین سکوت خواهیم داد، این (موفقیّت)، برای کسی است که از مقام (عدالت) من بترسد؛ و از عذاب (من) بیمناک باشد!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و البته جایگزین سازیم شما را در زمین پس از ایشان این برای آن کس است که بترسد جایگاه مرا و بترسد از تهدید من‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه شما را از پس آنها در آن سرزمين جاى خواهيم داد. اين براى آن كس است كه از مقام من بترسد و از بيم‌كردنم بهراسد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و به‌راستی و درستی شما را پس از ایشان (به جایشان) در (این) سرزمین سکونت خواهیم داد. این برای کسی است که از پایگاه (ربانی‌) و شأن من بهراسد، و از تهدیدم بیم داشته باشد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And establish you in their place. This is for him who fears My station, and dreads My commination."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And indeed We will establish you in the land after them; this is for him who fears to stand before Me and fears the commands of punishment declared by Me.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and We will surely make you to dwell in the land after them -- that, for him who fears My station and fears My threat.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We will surely cause you to dwell in the land after them: that is for him who feareth standing before Me and feareth My threat.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And indeed, We shall make you dwell in the land after them. This is for him who fears standing before Me (on the Day of Resurrection or fears My Punishment) and also fears My Threat."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “And We will settle you in the land after them. That is for him who fears My Majesty, and fears My threats.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and will then cause you to settle in the land as their successors. That is the reward for him who fears to stand for reckoning and holds My threat in awe."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And indeed, We shall make you dwell in the land after them. This is for him who fears standing before Me and also fears My threat."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily We shall make you to dwell in the land after them. This is for him who feareth My Majesty and feareth My threats.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and surely We will settle you in the land after them. This [promise] is for someone who is awed to stand before Me and fears My threat.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and let you live in the land after them. This is for him who fears My station and fears My threat'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We will surely cause you to dwell in the land after them. That is for he who fears My position and fears My threat."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and settle you in the land thereafter. This is for those who are afraid of Me and of My warning."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most certainly We will settle you in the land after them; this is for him who fears standing in My presence and who fears My threat.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walanuskinannakumu alarda min baAAdihim thalika liman khafa maqamee wakhafa waAAeedi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and settle you on the land to succeed them. That is [in store] for anyone who is in awe of meeting Me, and who heeds My warnings."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And verily We shall cause you to abide in the land, and succeed them. This for such as fear the Time when they shall stand before My tribunal,- such as fear the punishment denounced."

verses.text: وَ اسْتَفْتَحُوا وَ خَابَ‌ کُلُ‌ جَبَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و پیامبران [از خدا] درخواست گشایش و پیروزی کردند، و هر سرکش منحرفی [از رسیدن به هدفش] نومید شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پيروزى خواستند و هر جبار كينه‌توزى نوميد شد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آنها پيروزى خواستند و [سر انجام‌] هر زورگوى لجوجى ناكام شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [پيامبران از خدا] گشايش خواستند، و [سرانجام‌] هر زورگوى لجوجى نوميد شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (از خدا) فتح و پیروزی خواستند (و البته فتح و فیروزی بر حسب وعده ما نصیب رسولان خداست) و نصیب هر ستمگر جبار هلاکت و حرمان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و (پیغمبران از پروردگارشان) طلب پیروزی (و غلبه‌ی بر قوم خود) کردند (هنگامی که از ایمان آوردنشان مأیوس گشتند، و خداوند آنان را فتح و ظفر بخشید و سود بردند) و هر قلدر و گردنکش منحرف و باطلگرائی، زیانمند و نامراد گردید. [[«إِسْتَفْتَحُوا»: درخواست فتح و پیروزی کردند (نگا: بقره / 89، انفال / 19). «خَابَ»: پیروز نشد و به هدف نرسید. نامراد و زیانمند گردید. «جَبَّارٍ»: متکبّر. قلدر. گردنکش. «عَنِیدٍ»: باطلگرا. منحرف. دشمن حق و حقیقت. فعیل به معنی مُفاعِل، یعنی مُعانِد است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و [یاری و] داوری خواستند و هر زورگوی ستیزه‌جویی ناکام شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آنها (از خدا) تقاضای فتح و پیروزی (بر کفار) کردند؛ و (سرانجام) هر گردنکش منحرفی نومید و نابود شد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و پیروزی (یا گشایش) جستند و نومید شد هر گردنکش کینه‌ورزی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [پيامبران‌] گشايش و پيروزى خواستند، و هر گردنكش ستيزه‌گرى نوميد و زيانكار شد،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (پیامبران و کافران توأمان) از خدا گشایش خواستند و (سرانجام) هر زورگوی لجوجی نومید شد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then (the apostles) asked of God's assistance, and every arrogant tyrant was frustrated:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they sought a decision, and every stubborn rebel was destroyed.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They sought a judgment; then was disappointed every froward tyrant --

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they besought judgment, and disappointed was every tyrant obstinate.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But they (the Messengers) sought victory and help [from their Lord (Allah)], and every obstinate, arrogant dictator (who refuses to believe in the Oneness of Allah) was brought to a complete loss and destruction.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they prayed for victory, and every stubborn tyrant came to disappointment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They sought Our judgement. And (thanks to that judgement) every obstinate tyrant opposed to the Truth was brought to naught.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they sought victory and help; and every obstinate, arrogant dictator (who refuses to believe in the Oneness of Allah) was brought to a complete loss and destruction.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they sought help (from their Lord) and every froward potentate was bought to naught;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They prayed for victory [against the infidels], and every obstinate tyrant was defeated,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They sought a judgment, then every tyrant was disappointed.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they requested victory from Allah, and disappointed, [therefore], was every obstinate tyrant.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They prayed for victory and the haughty transgressors were defeated.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they asked for judgment and every insolent opposer was disappointed:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waistaftahoo wakhaba kullu jabbarin AAaneedin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When they sought Our Judgement, every stubborn oppressor was frustrated.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But they sought victory and decision (there and then), and frustration was the lot of every powerful obstinate transgressor.

verses.text: مِنْ‌ وَرَائِهِ‌ جَهَنَّمُ‌ وَ يُسْقَى‌ مِنْ‌ مَاءٍ صَدِيدٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [سرانجام] پیش روی او دوزخ است، و او را از آبی چرکین و متعفّن می نوشانند!!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پشت سرش جهنم است تا در آنجا از آب چرك و خونش بخورانند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: از پشت سرش جهنم است، و از آب چرك و خونش مى‌نوشانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [آن كس كه‌] دوزخ پيش روى اوست و به او آبى چركين نوشانده مى‌شود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: از پی گردنکش عنود آتش دوزخ خواهد بود و آبی که به او آشامند (در دوزخ) آب پلید چرکین است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: جلو او دوزخ قرار دارد و (در آن) از خونابه نوشانده می‌شود. [[«وَرَآءِ»: جلو. مقابل. این واژه از اضدّاد است و به معنی پشت سر و پیش روی آمده است و در اینجا به هر دو معنی، نتیجه یکی است. یعنی مراد از پشت سر و روبرو، سرانجام و عاقبت کار است. «صَدیدٍ»: خونابه. «مآءٍ صَدیدٍ»: آبی که خونابه است. (صَدِیدٍ) عطف بیان یا بَدَل است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که در پیشاپیش او جهنم است و از آبی زردابه‌آمیز به او می‌نوشانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به دنبال او جهنم خواهد بود؛ و از آب بد بوی متعفّنی نوشانده می‌شود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پشت سر او است دوزخ و نوشانیده شود از آب چرک خون آلود

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: فراروى او دوزخ است و او را زردابى از چرك خون‌آلود بنوشانند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (آن کس که) دوزخ از پی اوست و به او آبی مرگبار نوشانده می‌شود،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Before him is Hell, and he will get putrid liquid to drink.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Hell went after him, and he will be made to drink liquid pus*. (* Discharged from the wounds of other people in hell.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: beyond him Gehenna, and he is given to drink of oozing pus,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Behind him is Hell, and he shall be made to drink of fetid water.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: In front of him (every obstinate, arrogant dictator) is Hell, and he will be made to drink boiling, festering water.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Beyond him lies Hell, and he will be given to drink putrid water.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Hell is before him and he shall be made to drink of the oozing pus,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: In front of him is Hell, and he will be made to drink boiling, festering water.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Hell is before him, and he is made to drink a festering water,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: with hell lying ahead of him, [where] he shall be given to drink of a purulent fluid,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Gehenna (Hell) is before him and he is given oozing pus to drink,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Before him is Hell, and he will be given a drink of purulent water.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Thereafter they will face hell fire wherein they will drink boiling water.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Hell is before him and he shall be given to drink of festering water:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Min waraihi jahannamu wayusqa min main sadeedin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Beyond him is Hell, and he shall drink putrid water;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: In front of such a one is Hell, and he is given, for drink, boiling fetid water.

verses.text: يَتَجَرَّعُهُ‌ وَ لاَ يَکَادُ يُسِيغُهُ‌ وَ يَأْتِيهِ‌ الْمَوْتُ‌ مِنْ‌ کُلِ‌ مَکَانٍ‌ وَ مَا هُوَ بِمَيِّتٍ‌ وَ مِنْ‌ وَرَائِهِ‌ عَذَابٌ‌ غَلِيظٌ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن را [به سختی و مشقت] جرعه جرعه می نوشد، [و به خواست خود حاضر به نوشیدن نیست، بلکه به زور و جبر در گلویش می ریزند،] و [او] نمی تواند آن را به [آسانی] فرو برد، و مرگ از هر طرف به او رو می کند، ولی مردنی نیست، و عذابی سخت و انبوه به دنبال اوست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جرعه‌جرعه آن را مى‌نوشد و هيچ گواراى او نيست و مرگ از هر سو بر او مى‌تازد اما نمى‌ميرد، كه عذابى سخت در انتظار اوست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن را جرعه جرعه مى‌نوشد و نمى‌تواند آن را فرو برد، و مرگ از هر طرف به سويش مى‌آيد اما مردنى نيست، و عذابى سنگين به دنبال دارد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آن را جرعه جرعه مى‌نوشد و نمى‌تواند آن را فرو برد، و مرگ از هر جانبى به سويش مى‌آيد ولى نمى‌ميرد و عذابى سنگين به دنبال دارد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که آن آب پلید را جرعه جرعه می‌آشامد و هیچ گوارای او نشود، و از هر جانب مرگ به وی روی آور شود ولی نمیرد و فراروی او عذابی سخت خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آن را (به ناچار و با رنج بسیار) جرعه جرعه می‌نوشد، و به هیچ وجه گوارایش نمی‌یابد، و (موجبات) مرگ از هر سو بدو روی می‌آورد و حال این که نمی‌میرد، (تا از آنچه بدان مبتلا است نجات یابد) و بر سر راه او (هر زمان و آن) عذاب بسیار سختی است. [[«یَتَجَرَّعُهُ»: با زحمت و رنج آن را جرعه‌جرعه می‌نوشد. «لا یَکادُ یُسِیغُهُ»: اصلاً گوارایش نمی‌یابد. «یَأْتِیهِ الْمَوْتُ»: مراد اسباب و موجبات مرگ است. «مِن وَرَآئِهِ»: گذشته از عذاب قبلی. در برابر او و بر سر راه وی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که آن را جرعه جرعه بنوشد و نتواند فرو برد، و مرگ از هر سو به سراغ او آید و او مردنی نیست، و عذابی سخت و سنگین در پیشاپیش خود دارد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بزحمت جرعه جرعه آن را سرمی‌کشد؛ و هرگز حاضر نیست به میل خود آن را بیاشامد؛ و مرگ از هرجا به سراغ او می‌آید؛ ولی با این همه نمی‌میرد! و بدنبال آن، عذاب شدیدی است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جرعه جرعه نوشدش و نیارد فروبردش (گوارا شودش) و بیایدش مرگ از همه سوی و نیست او مرده و از پس او است عذابی انبوه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه آن را جرعه جرعه مى‌آشامد و او را فروبردن آن آسان و گوارا نيست- از گندى و تلخى نمى‌تواند آن را به آسانى فروبرد تا رهايى يابد- و مرگ از هر جا به او روى آورد اما او مردنى نيست، و فراروى او عذابى سخت و سهمگين است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آن را جرعه جرعه می‌نوشد و نتواند آن را به آسانی و خوشی فرو برد و مرگ از هر جانبی سویش می‌آید - حال آنکه مرده نیست- و عذابی سنگین را به دنبال دارد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He will sip it, yet will not be able to gulp it down. Death will crowd in upon him from every side, but die he will not. A terrible torment trails him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He will sip it with difficulty but be unable to swallow, and death will approach him from every side and he will not die; and a severe punishment is after him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: the which he gulps, and can scarce swallow, and death comes upon him from every side, yet he cannot die; and still beyond him is a harsh chastisement.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Which he gulpeth, but wellnigh swalloweth not. And death cometh upon him from every side, while yet he is not dead, and behind him is a torment terrible.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He will sip it unwillingly, and he will find a great difficulty to swallow it down his throat, and death will come to him from every side, yet he will not die and in front of him, will be a great torment.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He will guzzle it, but he will not swallow it. Death will come at him from every direction, but he will not die. And beyond this is relentless suffering.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: which he will gulp but will scarcely swallow, and death will come upon him from every quarter, and yet he will not be able to die. A terrible chastisement lies ahead in pursuit of him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He will sip it unwillingly, and he will find great difficulty in swallowing it down his throat, and death will come to him from every side, yet he will not die, and in front of him, will be a great torment.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Which he sippeth but can hardly swallow, and death cometh unto him from every side while yet he cannot die, and before him is a harsh doom.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: gulping it down, but hardly swallowing it: death will assail him from every side, but he will not die, and there is [yet] a harsh punishment ahead of him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: which he gulps and can scarcely swallow. Death will come to him from every side, yet he cannot not die, and yet to come is a dreadful punishment.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He will gulp it but will hardly [be able to] swallow it. And death will come to him from everywhere, but he is not to die. And before him is a massive punishment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: As they sip the unpleasant water, death will approach them from all sides, but they will never die. In addition to this, they will experience the most intense torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He will drink it little by little and will not be able to swallow it agreeably, and death will come to him from every quarter, but he shall not die; and there shall be vehement chastisement before him.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: YatajarraAAuhu wala yakadu yuseeghuhu wayateehi almawtu min kulli makanin wama huwa bimayyitin wamin waraihi AAathabun ghaleethun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: he will sip and will not find it easy to swallow it. Death will approach him from every quarter, yet he will not die. More intense suffering will lie ahead of him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: In gulps will he sip it, but never will he be near swallowing it down his throat: death will come to him from every quarter, yet will he not die: and in front of him will be a chastisement unrelenting.

verses.text: مَثَلُ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ‌ أَعْمَالُهُمْ‌ کَرَمَادٍ اشْتَدَّتْ‌ بِهِ‌ الرِّيحُ‌ فِي‌ يَوْمٍ‌ عَاصِفٍ‌ لاَ يَقْدِرُونَ‌ مِمَّا کَسَبُوا عَلَى‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ ذٰلِکَ‌ هُوَ الضَّلاَلُ‌ الْبَعِيدُ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: وصف حال کسانی که به پروردگارشان کافر شدند [این گونه است] اعمالشان مانند خاکستری است که در یک روز توفانی، تند بادی بر آن بوزد [و آن را به صورتی که هرگز نتوان جمع کرد، پراکنده کند] آنان نمی توانند از اعمال خیری که انجام داده اند، چیزی [برای ارائه به بازار قیامت جهت کسب ثواب و پاداش] به دست آورند؛ این است آن گمراهی دور.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مثَل اعمال كسانى كه به خدا كافر شده‌اند چون خاكسترى است كه در روزى طوفانى بادى سخت بر آن بوزد. توان نگه‌داشتن آنچه را كه به دست آورده‌اند ندارند. اين است گمراهى بى‌انتها.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مثل كسانى كه به پروردگار خود كافر شدند، اعمالشان همچون خاكسترى است كه در روز طوفانى باد شديدى بر آن بوزد، كه به چيزى از آنچه كسب كرده‌اند دست نيابند. اين همان گمراهى دور است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مَثَل كسانى كه به پروردگار خود كافر شدند، كردارهايشان به خاكسترى مى‌ماند كه بادى تند در روزى طوفانى بر آن بوزد: از آنچه به دست آورده‌اند هيچ [بهره‌اى‌] نمى‌توانند بُرد. اين است همان گمراهى دور و دراز.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مثل اعمال کسانی که به خدا کافر شدند به خاکستری می‌ماند که در روز تند باد شدید همه به باد فنا رود، که از همه کوشش خود هیچ نتیجه نبرند. این همان ضلالت (و حسرت) دور (از طریق نجات) است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: حال و وضع اعمال کسانی که به پروردگار خود ایمان ندارند، همچون حال و وضع خاکستری است که در یک روز طوفانی، باد به تندی بر آن وزد (و آن را در هوا پخش و پراکنده کند و چیزی از آن برجای نگذارد. چنین کافرانی هم در روز قیامت) به چیزی از آنچه در دنیا (از اعمال نیک) انجام داده‌اند دست نمی‌یابند. (چرا که گِردباد کفر بر خاکستر اعمالشان وزیده است و آن را به غارت برده است) این (تلاش و کوشش بیراهه و بی‌بهره) گمراهی سختی، (و حاصل سرگردانی و سرگشتگی شگفتی) است. [[«مَثَلُ»: صفت. حال و وضع. «رَمَادٍ»: خاکستر. «عَاصِفٍ»: طوفانی. «ذلِکَ»: این کار و کوشش همراه با کفر و زندقه. این سرانجام بد و تباه. «الضَّلالُ»: گمراهی. سرگشتگی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: داستان اعمال کسانی که به پروردگارشان کفرورزیده‌اند، همچون خاکستری است که در روز طوفانی، باد بر آن بوزد، که از آنچه به دست آورده‌اند، چیزی در دست ندارند، این همان گمراهی دور و دراز است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اعمال کسانی که به پروردگارشان کافر شدند، همچون خاکستری است در برابر تندباد در یک روز طوفانی! آنها توانایی ندارند کمترین چیزی از آنچه را انجام داده‌اند، به دست آورند؛ و این همان گمراهی دور و دراز است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مثَل آنان که کفر ورزیدند به پروردگار خویش کردار ایشان مانند خاکستری است که بوزد بدان باد در روزی تند قادر نباشند از آنچه فراهم کردند بر چیزی این است آن گمراهی دور

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: داستان آنان كه به پروردگارشان كافر شدند [اين است كه‌] كردارشان چون خاكسترى است كه بادى سخت در روزى تندباد بر آن بوزد، كه بر هيچ چيزى از آنچه كرده‌اند دست نتوانند يافت. اين است گمراهى دور.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مَثَل کسانی که به پروردگارشان کافر شدند؛ کردارهایشان به خاکستری می‌ماند که بادی تند در روزی طوفانی بر آن وزید. از آنچه به دست آورده‌اند هیچ (بهره‌ای) نمی‌توانند برد. این است همان گمراهی دور و دراز.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Like ashes are the deeds of those who deny their Lord, which the wind blows away on a windy day. They shall have no power over what they earned. This is the farthest limit of going astray.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The state of those who disbelieve in their Lord is that their deeds are like ashes which the strong wind blew away on a stormy day; they got nothing from all that they earned; this is the extreme error.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: The likeness of those who disbelieve in their Lord: their works are as ashes, whereon the wind blows strong upon a tempestuous day; they have no power over that they have earned - that is the far error!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The likeness of those who disbelieve in their Lord: their works are like ashes upon which the wind bloweth hard on a stormy day: they shall not be able to get aught of that which they have earned. That! that is the straying far-off

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The parable of those who disbelieve in their Lord is that their works are as ashes, on which the wind blows furiously on a stormy day, they shall not be able to get aught of what they have earned. That is the straying, far away (from the Right Path).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The likeness of those who disbelieve in their Lord: their works are like ashes, in a fierce wind, on a stormy day. They have no control over anything they have earned. That is the utmost misguidance.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: This is the example of those who disbelieve in their Lord: their works are like ashes upon which the wind blows fiercely on a tempestuous day. They shall find no reward for their deeds. That indeed is the farthest point in straying.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The parable of those who disbelieved in their Lord is that their works are as ashes, on which the wind blows furiously on a stormy day; they shall not be able to get aught of what they have earned. That is the straying, far away (from the right path).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: A similitude of those who disbelieve in their Lord: Their works are as ashes which the wind bloweth hard upon a stormy day. They have no control of aught that they have earned. That is the extreme failure.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: A parable of those who defy their Lord: their deeds are like ashes over which the wind blows hard on a tempestuous day: they have no power over anything they have earned. That is extreme error.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As for the likeness of those who disbelieve in their Lord, their works are like ashes which a strong wind scatters on a stormy day; they are powerless over that they have earned; that is the far error.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is [that] their deeds are like ashes which the wind blows forcefully on a stormy day; they are unable [to keep] from what they earned a [single] thing. That is what is extreme error.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The deeds of those who deny the existence of their Lord are like ashes blown about by a strong wind on a stormy day. They will achieve nothing from their deeds. (What they have done) is a manifest error.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The parable of those who disbelieve in their Lord: their actions are like ashes on which the wind blows hard on a stormy day; they shall not have power over any thing out of what they have earned; this is the great error.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Mathalu allatheena kafaroo birabbihim aAAmaluhum karamadin ishtaddat bihi alrreehu fee yawmin AAasifin la yaqdiroona mimma kasaboo AAala shayin thalika huwa alddalalu albaAAeedu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The works of those who deny their Lord are like ashes which the wind scatters on a stormy day: they shall gain nothing from what they do. To act thus is to stray far into error.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The parable of those who reject their Lord is that their works are as ashes, on which the wind blows furiously on a tempestuous day: No power have they over aught that they have earned: that is the straying far, far (from the goal).

verses.text: أَ لَمْ‌ تَرَ أَنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ خَلَقَ‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ الْأَرْضَ‌ بِالْحَقِ‌ إِنْ‌ يَشَأْ يُذْهِبْکُمْ‌ وَ يَأْتِ‌ بِخَلْقٍ‌ جَدِيدٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [ای انسان!] آیا [به طور قطع و یقین] ندانسته ای که خدا آسمان ها و زمین را بر پایه درستی و راستی و نظم و حساب آفرید؟ اگر بخواهد شما را از میان می برد، و خلقی جدید می آورد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا نديده‌اى كه خدا آسمانها و زمين را به حق آفريده است؟ اگر بخواهد شما را مى‌برد و مخلوقى تازه مى‌آورد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا نديدى كه خدا آسمان‌ها و زمين را به حق آفريده است؟ اگر بخواهد شما را مى‌برد و خلق تازه‌اى مى‌آورد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا در نيافته‌اى كه خدا آسمانها و زمين را به حق آفريده؟ اگر بخواهد شما را مى‌برد و خلق تازه‌اى مى‌آورد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای بشر) آیا ندانستی که خدا آسمانها و زمین را به حق و برای مقصود بزرگی آفریده و اگر بخواهد شما (جنس بشر) همه را در زمین نابود می‌سازد و خلقی دیگر از نو می‌آفریند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای مخاطب!) آیا نمی‌بینی که خداوند، آسمانها و زمین را چنان که باید آفریده است (و آنها را هماهنگ و منظّم و مرتّب پدیدار کرده و سر و سامان و نظم و نظام بخشیده است). اگر بخواهد شما (مردمان نافرمان و ناسپاس) را از میان می‌برد و انسانهای (فرمانبردار و سپاسگزار) تازه‌ای را پدید می‌آورد. [[«بِالْحَقِّ»: به حق. چنان که باید. یعنی هماهنگ و منظّم و دارای حکمت و هدف.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا ندانسته‌ای که خداوند آسمانها و زمین را به حق آفریده است، اگر بخواهد شما را [از میان‌] می‌برد و آفریدگان جدیدی به میان می‌آورد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا ندیدی خداوند، آسمانها و زمین را بحق آفریده است؟! اگر بخواهد، شما را می‌برد و خلق تازه‌ای می‌آورد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا نبینی که خدا بیافریده است آسمانها و زمین را به حقّ اگر خواهد می‌برد شما را و می‌آورد آفرینشی نوین‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا نديده‌اى- ندانسته‌اى- كه خدا آسمانها و زمين را بحق آفريده است؟ اگر خواهد شما را مى‌برد و آفريده‌اى نو مى‌آورد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا ندیدی [:درنیافتی] که خدا به‌راستی آسمان‌ها و زمین را به حق آفرید؟ اگر بخواهد شما را می‌برد و خلق تازه‌ای (به جایتان) می‌آورد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do you not see that God has created the heavens and the earth with ultimate reason? If He so wills He could take you away from the earth and raise a new creation (in your place).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Have you not seen that Allah has created the heavens and the earth with true purpose? If He wills, He can remove you all and bring a new creation.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Hast thou not seen that God created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He will, He can put you away and bring a new creation;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Beholdest thou not that Allah hath created the heavens and the earth with a purpose? If He willed He would make you pass away and bring a creation new.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Do you not see that Allah has created the heavens and the earth with truth? If He will, He can remove you and bring (in your place) a new creation!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do you not see that God created the heavens and the earth with truth? If He wills, He can do away with you, and bring a new creation.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do you not see that Allah created the heavens and the earth in Truth? Were He to will, He could take you away and bring a new creation.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do you not see that Allah has created the heavens and the earth with truth If He wills, He can remove you and bring (in your place) a new creation!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Hast thou not seen that Allah hath created the heavens and the earth with truth? If He will, He can remove you and bring (in) some new creation;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Have you not regarded that Allah created the heavens and the earth with justice? If He wishes, He will take you away, and bring about a new creation,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do you not see that Allah has created the heavens and the earth with truth? He can put you away if He will and bring into being a new creation;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Have you not seen that Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can do away with you and produce a new creation.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you not realize that God has created the heavens and the earth for a genuine purpose

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Do you not see that Allah created the heavens and the earth with truth? If He please He will take you off and bring a new creation,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alam tara anna Allaha khalaqa alssamawati waalarda bialhaqqi in yasha yuthhibkum wayati bikhalqin jadeedin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do you not see that God has created the heavens and the earth for a purpose? He can eliminate you if He wills and bring into being a new creation:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Seest thou not that Allah created the heavens and the earth in Truth? If He so will, He can remove you and put (in your place) a new creation?

verses.text: وَ مَا ذٰلِکَ‌ عَلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ بِعَزِيزٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و این [کار] بر خدا دشوار و گران نیست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اين بر خدا دشوار نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اين بر خدا دشوار نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اين [كار] بر خدا دشوار نيست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و این کار اصلا بر خدا دشوار نیست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و این کارِ (میراندن شما و به جهان گسیل داشتن دیگران) برای خدا مشکل نیست. [[«عَزِیز»: سخت و مشکل.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و این بر خداوند دشوار نیست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و این کار برای خدا مشکل نیست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیست آن بر خدا گران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اين بر خدا دشوار نيست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و این کار بزرگ بر خدا(ی بزرگ) دشوار نیست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: This is well within the power of God.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And this is not at all difficult for Allah.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: that is surely no great matter for God.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And for Allah that is not hard.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And for Allah that is not hard or difficult (i.e. very easy for Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And that is not difficult for God.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: That is not at all difficult for Allah.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And for Allah that is not hard or difficult.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And that is no great matter for Allah.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and that is not a formidable thing for Allah.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: indeed, that is no great thing for Allah.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And that is not difficult for Allah.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and that it is not at all difficult for God to replace you with another creature if He so wills?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And this is not difficult for Allah.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama thalika AAala Allahi biAAazeezin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: that is no difficult thing for God.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nor is that for Allah any great matter.

verses.text: وَ بَرَزُوا لِلَّهِ‌ جَمِيعاً فَقَالَ‌ الضُّعَفَاءُ لِلَّذِينَ‌ اسْتَکْبَرُوا إِنَّا کُنَّا لَکُمْ‌ تَبَعاً فَهَلْ‌ أَنْتُمْ‌ مُغْنُونَ‌ عَنَّا مِنْ‌ عَذَابِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ مِنْ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ قَالُوا لَوْ هَدَانَا اللَّهُ‌ لَهَدَيْنَاکُمْ‌ سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَ جَزِعْنَا أَمْ‌ صَبَرْنَا مَا لَنَا مِنْ‌ مَحِيصٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [در عرصه قیامت] همگی در پیشگاه خدا ظاهر می شوند؛ پس ناتوانان [ی که بدون به کار گرفتن عقل، بلکه از روی تقلید کورکورانه پیرو مستکبران بودند] به مستکبران می گویند: ما [در دنیا بدون درخواست دلیل و برهان] پیروِ [مکتب] شما بودیم، آیا امروز چیزی از عذاب خدا را [به پاداش آنکه از شما پیروی کردیم] از ما برطرف می کنید؟ می گویند: اگر خدا ما را [در صورت داشتن لیاقت] هدایت کرده بود، همانا ما هم شما را هدایت می کردیم، [اکنون همه سرمایه های وجودی ما و تلاش و کوششمان بر باد رفته] چه بیتابی کنیم وچه شکیبایی ورزیم، برای ما یکسان است، ما را هیچ راه گریزی نیست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: همه در پيشگاه خدا حاضر آيند. ناتوانان به آنان كه گردنكشى مى‌كردند گويند: ما پيرو شما بوديم. آيا اكنون مى‌توانيد ما را به كار آييد و اندكى از عذاب خدا را از ما دفع كنيد؟ گويند: اگر خدا ما را هدايت كرده بود، ما نيز شما را هدايت مى‌كرديم. حال ما را راه خلاصى نيست، براى ما يكسان است چه بيتابى كنيم، چه شكيبايى ورزيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [در قيامت‌] همگى در برابر خدا حاضر شوند. پس ضعيفان به گردنكشان گويند: ما پيروان شما بوديم، آيا شما [مى‌توانيد] چيزى از عذاب خدا را از ما دفع كنيد؟ مى‌گويند: اگر خدا ما را هدايت كرده بود، قطعا شما را هدايت مى‌كرديم. حال چه بى‌تابى كنيم يا صبورى كني

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و همگى در برابر خدا ظاهر مى‌شوند. پس ناتوانان به گردنكشان مى‌گويند: «ما پيروان شما بوديم. آيا چيزى از عذاب خدا را از ما دور مى‌كنيد؟» مى‌گويند: «اگر خدا ما را هدايت كرده بود، قطعاً شما را هدايت مى‌كرديم. چه بى‌تابى كنيم، چه صبر نماييم براى ما يكسان است. ما را راهِ گريزى نيست.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (روزی که) مردم از قبرها برانگیخته و به پیشگاه خدا حاضر شوند آن گاه ضعیفان به گردنکشان گویند: ما (در دنیا) تابع رأی شما بودیم آیا (امروز) شما هیچ از عذاب خدا ما را کفایت خواهید کرد؟ جواب دهند که اگر ما را از خدا سعادت هدایت بود ما هم شما را هدایت می‌کردیم، اکنون هر چه جزع و التماس کنیم یا صبر و تحمل، یکسان است و هیچ (از عذاب) گریزگاهی نداریم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (روزی که قیامت نام دارد) همه در برابر خدا ظاهر و آشکار می‌گردند. (در این هنگام) ضعیفان (که پیروان نادان نیرومندانند، از راه تمسخر) به کسانی می‌گویند که خویشتن را (در دنیا) بزرگ می‌پنداشتند: ما پیروان شما بودیم، آیا می‌توانید چیزی از عذاب خدا را از سر ما بردارید؟! (در پاسخ) می‌گویند: اگر خداوند ما را (به راه رستگاری) رهنمود می‌کرد، ما هم شما را (به راه نجات) رهنمود می‌کردیم، (ولی ما خودمان گمراه بودیم و شما را نیز گمراه کردیم. هم اینک) چه بی‌تابی کنیم و چه شکیبائی نمائیم یکسان است (و سودی به حال خراب ما ندارد، و از عذاب خدا) راه نجات و گریزی برای ما نیست. [[«بَرَزُوا»: آشکار شدند. به دشت فراخی آمدند. «تَبَعاً»: پیروان. مصدر است و به صورت وصف جمع، یعنی تابعان آمده است. «مُغْنُونَ»: بی‌نیاز کنندگان. کفایت‌کنندگان. دفع کنندگان. «مَحِیصٍ»: راه نجات. گریزگاه.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و همه در پیشگاه خداوند حاضر آیند، آنگاه درماندگان به گردنکشان گویند ما پیرو شما بودیم، آیا شما باز دارنده چیزی از عذاب الهی از ما هستید؟ گویند اگر خداوند ما را هدایت کرده بود، ما نیز شما را هدایت می‌کردیم، برای ما یکسان است چه زاری و بی‌تابی کنیم و چه شکیبایی ورزیم، گریزگاهی نداریم،

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و (در قیامت)، همه آنها در برابر خدا ظاهر می‌شوند؛ در این هنگام، ضعفا [= دنباله‌روان نادان‌] به مستکبران (و رهبران گمراه) می‌گویند: «ما پیروان شما بودیم! آیا (اکنون که بخاطر پیروی از شما گرفتار مجازات الهی شده‌ایم،) شما حاضرید سهمی از عذاب الهی را بپذیرید و از ما بردارید؟» آنها می‌گویند: «اگر خدا ما را هدایت کرده بود، ما نیز شما را هدایت می‌کردیم! (ولی کار از اینها گذشته است،) چه بیتابی کنیم و چه شکیبایی، تفاوتی برای ما ندارد؛ راه گریزی برای ما نیست!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برون آمدند پیشگاه خدا همگی پس گفتند ناتوانان بدانان که سرکشی ورزیدند که بودیم ما شما را پیروانی آیا هستید بی‌نیازکننده ما از عذاب خدا به چیزی گفتند اگر رهبری می‌کرد ما را خدا هر آینه راهبریتان می‌کردیم یکسان است بر ما چه بی‌تابی کنیم و چه شکیبا شویم نیست ما را چاره‌ای‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همگى در پيشگاه خدا پديدار شوند، آنگاه ناتوانان به كسانى كه گردنكشى و بزرگ‌منشى مى‌كردند گويند: ما [در دنيا] پيرو شما بوديم، پس آيا [امروز] شما مى‌توانيد چيزى از عذاب خدا را از ما باز داريد؟ گويند: اگر خدا ما را [به رهايى از عذاب‌] راه نموده بود ما نيز شما را راه مى‌نموديم، بر ما يكسان است چه زارى و بى‌تابى كنيم يا شكيبايى نماييم ما را هيچ گريزگاهى نيست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و همگان به پیشگاه خدای(شان) عیان شدند. پس ناتوانان به مستکبران گفتند: «ما بی‌گمان پیروان شما بوده‌ایم، پس آیا چیزی از عذاب خدا را از ما کفایت و جبران می‌کنید؟» گفتند: «اگر خدا ما را هدایت کرده بود، به‌راستی شما را هدایت می‌کردیم. چه بی‌تابی کنیم و چه تاب آوریم بر ما یکسان است. ما را راه هیچ‌گونه گریزی (از عذاب خدا) نیست.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When they will all appear before God together, the weak will say to those who were arrogant: "We were your followers, so can you now save us a little from God's punishment?" They will say: "If we had been guided by God we would surely have shown you the way. To lament or endure is all the same to us now. No getting away is there for us."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They will all publicly come in the presence of Allah – then those who were weak will say to those who were the leaders, “We were your followers – is it possible for you to avert some of Allah’s punishment from us?” They will answer, “If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you; it is the same for us, whether we panic or patiently endure – we have no place of refuge.” (* This conversation will take place between the disbelievers and their leaders.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They sally forth unto God, all together; then say the weak to those who waxed proud, 'We were your followers; will you avail us against the chastisement of God anything?' They say, 'If God had guided us, we would have guided you. Alike it is for us whether we cannot endure, or whether we are patient; we have no asylum.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they all shall appear before Allah, then those who were counted weak shall say to those who were stiff-necked: verily we were unto you a following, are ye going to avail us at all against the torment of AllAh? They Will say: had Allah guided, We would have guided you also; it is equal unto us whether we become impatient or bear patiently; for us there is no place of escape.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they all shall appear before Allah (on the Day of Resurrection) then the weak will say to those who were arrogant (chiefs): "Verily, we were following you; can you avail us anything from Allah's Torment?" They will say: "Had Allah guided us, we would have guided you. It makes no difference to us (now) whether we rage, or bear (these torments) with patience, there is no place of refuge for us."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will emerge before God, altogether. The weak will say to those who were proud, “We were your followers, can you protect us at all against God’s punishment?” They will say, “Had God guided us, we would have guided you. It is the same for us; whether we mourn, or are patient; there is no asylum for us.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then all of them will appear exposed before Allah, and the weak ones will say to the haughty ones: "We merely followed you. Will you, then, protect us from Allah's chastisement?" They will say: "Had Allah shown us the Way to our salvation, we would surely have also guided you. Now it is all the same whether we cry or suffer patiently, we have no escape."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they all shall appear before Allah; then the weak will say to those who were arrogant: "Verily, we were following you; can you avail us anything against Allah's torment" They will say: "Had Allah guided us, we would have guided you. It makes no difference to us (now) whether we rage, or bear (these torments) with patience; there is no place of refuge for us."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They all come forth unto their Lord. Then those who were despised say unto those who were scornful: We were unto you a following, can ye then avert from us aught of Allah's doom? They say: Had Allah guided us, we should have guided you. Whether we rage or patiently endure is (now) all one for us; we have no place of refuge.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Together they will be presented before Allah. Then those who were weak will say to the arrogant [leaders], ‘Indeed we were your followers. So will you avail us against Allah’s punishment in any wise?’ They will say, ‘Had Allah guided us, surely we would have guided you. It is the same to us whether we are restless or patient: there is no escape for us.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Together they shall all come before Allah. Then the weak will say to those who were proud: 'We were your followers. Can you help us in anything against the punishment of Allah' They will say: 'Had Allah guided us we would have guided you. It is now the same for us whether we cannot endure or bear patiently, we have no place of refuge'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they will come out [for judgement] before Allah all together, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "Indeed, we were your followers, so can you avail us anything against the punishment of Allah?" They will say, "If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is all the same for us whether we show intolerance or are patient: there is for us no place of escape."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (On the Day of Judgment) everyone will appear before God and those who have been suppressed will say to their oppressors, "We were your followers, can you do anything to rescue us from the torment of God?" They will reply, "Had God guided us, we would also have guided you. It makes no difference whether we cry for help or exercise patience; there is no escape for us."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they shall all come forth before Allah, then the weak shall say to those who were proud: Surely we were your followers, can you therefore avert from us any part of the chastisement of Allah? They would say: If Allah had guided us, we too would have guided you; it is the same to us whether we are impatient (now) or patient, there is no place for us to fly to.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wabarazoo lillahi jameeAAan faqala aldduAAafao lillatheena istakbaroo inna kunna lakum tabaAAan fahal antum mughnoona AAanna min AAathabi Allahi min shayin qaloo law hadana Allahu lahadaynakum sawaon AAalayna ajaziAAna am sabarna ma lana min maheesin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They shall all appear before God and the weak will say to those who behaved proudly, "We were your followers. Can you protect us from God's punishment?" They will reply, "Had God given us guidance, we would have guided you. It is all the same whether we are patient or impatient; there is no escape for us."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They will all be marshalled before Allah together: then will the weak say to those who were arrogant, "For us, we but followed you; can ye then avail us to all against the wrath of Allah?" They will reply, "If we had received the Guidance of Allah, we should have given it to you: to us it makes no difference (now) whether we rage, or bear (these torments) with patience: for ourselves there is no way of escape."

verses.text: وَ قَالَ‌ الشَّيْطَانُ‌ لَمَّا قُضِيَ‌ الْأَمْرُ إِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ وَعَدَکُمْ‌ وَعْدَ الْحَقِ‌ وَ وَعَدْتُکُمْ‌ فَأَخْلَفْتُکُمْ‌ وَ مَا کَانَ‌ لِي‌ عَلَيْکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ سُلْطَانٍ‌ إِلاَّ أَنْ‌ دَعَوْتُکُمْ‌ فَاسْتَجَبْتُمْ‌ لِي‌ فَلاَ تَلُومُونِي‌ وَ لُومُوا أَنْفُسَکُمْ‌ مَا أَنَا بِمُصْرِخِکُمْ‌ وَ مَا أَنْتُمْ‌ بِمُصْرِخِيَ‌ إِنِّي‌ کَفَرْتُ‌ بِمَا أَشْرَکْتُمُونِ‌ مِنْ‌ قَبْلُ‌ إِنَ‌ الظَّالِمِينَ‌ لَهُمْ‌ عَذَابٌ‌ أَلِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
