translations.text: And you inhabited the homes of those who wronged themselves, and it became clear to you how We dealt with them, and We cited for you the examples.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: You said so even though you had lived in the dwellings of those who had wronged themselves (by sinning), and you were aware how We dealt with them, and We had even explained to you all this by giving examples.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And you dwelt in the dwellings of men who wronged themselves, and it was clear to you how We dealt with them. And We put forth (many) parables for you."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And (have ye not) dwelt in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves (of old) and (hath it not) become plain to you how We dealt with them and made examples for you?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: while you dwelt in the dwellings of those who had wronged themselves [before], and it had been made clear to you how We had dealt with them [before you], and We had [also] cited examples for you?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: You lived in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it was clear to you how We dealt with them, and how We struck parables for you.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And you lived among the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them. And We presented for you [many] examples."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You lived in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, even though it was made clear to you how We dealt with them. We also showed you examples."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And you dwell in the abodes of those who were unjust to themselves, and it is clear to you how We dealt with them and We have made (them) examples to you.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wasakantum fee masakini allatheena thalamoo anfusahum watabayyana lakum kayfa faAAalna bihim wadarabna lakumu alamthala

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: You lived in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it was made clear to you how We had dealt with them and We gave you many examples.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And ye dwelt in the dwellings of men who wronged their own souls; ye were clearly shown how We dealt with them; and We put forth (many) parables in your behoof!"

verses.text: وَ قَدْ مَکَرُوا مَکْرَهُمْ‌ وَ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ‌ مَکْرُهُمْ‌ وَ إِنْ‌ کَانَ‌ مَکْرُهُمْ‌ لِتَزُولَ‌ مِنْهُ‌ الْجِبَالُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آنان [نهایت] نیرنگشان را [بر ضدِّ خدا و پیامبران] به کار گرفتند، و [کیفر عقوبت دنیایی و آخرتی] نیرنگشان نزد خداست و هر چند که از نیرنگشان کوه ها از جا کنده شود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنان نيرنگهاى خود نمودند و خدا از نيرنگهايشان آگاه بود. هر چند كه از نيرنگهايشان كوه از پاى درمى‌آمد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آنها نهايت نيرنگ خود را به كار زدند و مكرشان نزد خدا [معلوم‌] است، هر چند از مكرشان كوه‌ها از جا كنده شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به يقين آنان نيرنگ خود را به كار بردند، و [جزاى‌] مكرشان با خداست، هر چند از مكرشان كوهها از جاى كنده مى‌شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن ستمکاران بزرگترین مکر و مهمترین سیاست خویش را به کار بردند ولی مکر آنها پیش (قدرت و تقدیر) خدا (هیچ) است هر چند مکر (و سیاست) آنها به پایه‌ای باشد که کوهها بدان از جای کنده شوند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان نیرنگ خود را نمودند (و برای جلوگیری از دعوت آسمانی توطئه‌ها کردند و نقشه‌ها چیدند) و خدا از نیرنگشان آگاه است، و شریعت ثابت و استوار (همچون کوه‌های سر به فلک کشیده‌ی اسلام) با نیرنگ آنان از جای برکنده نمی‌شود. [[«عِندَ اللهِ مَکْرُهُمْ»: خدا از نیرنگشان آگاه است و می‌تواند آن را خنثی و بی‌اثر سازد. «إِنْ»: می‌تواند حرف نفی یا حرف شرط باشد. «اِن کَانَ»: نبوده است. اگر بوده باشد. اگر (إِنْ) حرف شرط باشد معنی آیه چنین می‌شود: آنان به نیرنگ نشستند و توطئه چیدند و خدا از نیرنگشان باخبر بود و آن را باطل و خنثی کرد، هرچند که نیرنگشان آن اندازه بزرگ و سترگ بود که می‌توانست کوهها را از جای برکند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی که نیرنگشان را ورزیدند و [کیفر] نیرنگشان با خداست، و گرچه کوهها در اثر نیرنگشان از جای بروند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها نهایت مکر (و نیرنگ) خود را به کار زدند؛ و همه مکرها (و توطئه‌هایشان) نزد خدا آشکار است، هر چند مکرشان چنان باشد که کوه‌ها را از جا برکند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا آوردند نیرنگ خویش را و نزد خدا است نیرنگ ایشان و هر چند باشد نیرنگ ایشان که نابود شود از آن کوه‌ها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همانا نيرنگ خويش به كار بردند و نيرنگشان نزد خداست- خدا به آن آگاه است- هر چند كه از نيرنگشان كوه‌ها از جا كنده شود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان نیرنگشان را به کار بردند و نیرنگشان تنها نزد خداست‌؛ هر چند از مکرشان کوه‌ها از جای برکنده می‌شده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Still they are plotting their plots, but evident are their plots to God, even though they are so adroit as to make the mountains move.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed they carried out their scheme, and their scheming is within Allah’s control; and their scheme was not such that could move these mountains*. (* The revelations / signs of Allah.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They devised their devising, and their devising is known to God; though their devising were such as to remove mountains.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And of a surety theys Plotted their plot, and with Allah was their plot, though their plot was such as to remove thereby mountains.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Indeed, they planned their plot, and their plot was with Allah, though their plot was a great (one, still) it would never be able to remove the mountains (real mountains or the Islamic law) from their places (as it is of no importance) [Tafsir Ibn Kathir, Vol. 2, Page 597]. [It is said by some interpreters regarding this Verse that the Quraish pagans plotted against Prophet Muhammad SAW to kill him but they failed and were unable to carry out their plot which they plotted].

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They planned their plans, but their plans are known to God, even if their plans can eliminate mountains.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Indeed the unbelievers contrived their plan, but it is in Allah's power to nullify their plan, even though their plans were such that would move even mountains.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Indeed, they planned their plot, and their plot was with Allah, though their plot was not such as to remove the mountains from their places.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Verily they have plotted their plot, and their plot is with Allah, though their plot were one whereby the mountains should be moved.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They certainly devised their plots, but their plots are known to Allah, and their plots are not such as to dislodge the mountains.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They plotted their plots, but their plots are (known) to Allah, even though their plots were such as to move mountains.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they had planned their plan, but with Allah is [recorded] their plan, even if their plan had been [sufficient] to do away with the mountains.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They devised evil plans which were so sinful that even the mountains could not endure them. All these were known to God.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they have indeed planned their plan, but their plan is with Allah, though their plan was such that the mountains should pass away thereby.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqad makaroo makrahum waAAinda Allahi makruhum wain kana makruhum litazoola minhu aljibalu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They hatched their plots; but these plots were all within God's knowledge. Though their plots were such as to shake the mountains, God will bring their plots to nothing.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Mighty indeed were the plots which they made, but their plots were (well) within the sight of Allah, even though they were such as to shake the hills!

verses.text: فَلاَ تَحْسَبَنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ مُخْلِفَ‌ وَعْدِهِ‌ رُسُلَهُ‌ إِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ عَزِيزٌ ذُو انتِقَامٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس مپندار که خدا در وعده اش با پیامبرانش وفا نمی کند؛ زیرا خدا توانای شکست ناپذیر و صاحب انتقام است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مپندار كه خدا وعده‌اى را كه به پيامبرانش داده است خلاف مى‌كند. خداوند پيروزمند و انتقام‌گيرنده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس خدا را خلاف كننده‌ى وعده‌ى خويش با پيامبرانش مپندار چرا كه خداوند شكست‌ناپذير انتقام‌گير است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس مپندار كه خدا وعده خود را به پيامبرانش خلاف مى‌كند، كه خدا شكست‌ناپذيرِ انتقام‌گيرنده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس هرگز مپندار که خدا وعده خود با رسولانش را خلاف کند که البته خدا مقتدر و انتقام کشنده است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گمان مبر که خداوند با پیغمبران خلاف وعده می‌کند (و پیروزی را نصیب آنان و شکست را بهره‌ی کافران نمی‌سازد). بی‌گمان خداوند چیره (بر هر کاری بوده و از کافران و بزهکاران) انتقام گیرنده است. [[«مُخْلِفَ»: خلاف‌کننده. عهدشکن. «وَعْدِهِ»: (نگا: نور / 55، غافر / 51، مجادله / 21).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و هرگز خداوند را خلاف‌کننده وعده‌ای که به پیامبرانش داده است مینگار، چرا که خداوند پیروزمند دادستان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس گمان مبر که خدا وعده‌ای را که به پیامبرانش داده، تخلّف کند! چرا که خداوند قادر و انتقام گیرنده است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گمان مبر خدا را شکننده وعده خویش به فرستادگان خود همانا خدا عزّتمند است دارای انتقام‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس مپندار كه خدا وعده خود را با فرستادگان خويش خلاف مى‌كند، همانا خدا تواناى بى‌همتا و كين‌ستان است

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس هرگز مپندار که خدا وعده‌ی خود را به پیامبرانش خلاف‌کننده است. همواره خدا عزیز و صاحب انتقام است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Think not that God would go back on His promise (made) to the apostles. Indeed God is mighty, the Lord of retribution.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So do not ever assume that Allah will not fulfil His promise to His Noble Messengers; indeed Allah is the Dominant, the Avenger.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So do not deem that God will fail in His promise to His Messengers; surely God is All-mighty, Vengeful.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So deem not thouthat Allah is going to fail His promise to His apostles; verily Allah is Mighty, Lord of vengeance

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So think not that Allah will fail to keep His Promise to His Messengers. Certainly, Allah is All-Mighty, - All-Able of Retribution.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do not ever think that God will break His promise to His messengers. God is Strong, Able to Avenge.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So, do not think, (O Prophet), that Allah will go back upon His promise to His Messengers. Surely Allah is Mighty, Lord of retribution.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So think not that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His Messengers. Certainly, Allah is All-Mighty, All-Able of Retribution.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So think not that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His messengers. Lo! Allah is Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So do not suppose that Allah will break His promise to His apostles. Indeed Allah is all-mighty, avenger.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do not think that Allah will break the promise He gave to His Messengers. Mighty is Allah, and Vengeful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So never think that Allah will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You must not even think that God will disregard His promise to His messengers. God is Majestic and Revengeful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore do not think Allah (to be one) failing in His promise to His apostles; surely Allah is Mighty, the Lord of Retribution.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fala tahsabanna Allaha mukhlifa waAAdihi rusulahu inna Allaha AAazeezun thoo intiqamin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Never think that God will fail in His promise to His messengers. God is mighty and capable of retribution.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Never think that Allah would fail his messengers in His promise: for Allah is Exalted in power, - the Lord of Retribution.

verses.text: يَوْمَ‌ تُبَدَّلُ‌ الْأَرْضُ‌ غَيْرَ الْأَرْضِ‌ وَ السَّمَاوَاتُ‌ وَ بَرَزُوا لِلَّهِ‌ الْوَاحِدِ الْقَهَّارِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [در] روزی که زمین به غیر این زمین، و آسمان ها [به غیر این آسمان ها] تبدیل شود، و [همه] در پیشگاه خدای یگانه قهّار حاضر شوند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آن روز كه زمين به زمينى جز اين بدل شود و آسمانها به آسمانى ديگر، و همه در پيشگاه خداى واحد قهار حاضر آيند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: روزى كه زمين به زمين ديگر و آسمان‌ها [به آسمان‌هاى ديگر] مبدل شود، و [مردم‌] در برابر خداى يگانه قهار ظاهر شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: روزى كه زمين به غير اين زمين، و آسمانها [به غير اين آسمانها] مبدل گردد، و [مردم‌] در برابر خداى يگانه قهار ظاهر شوند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: روزی که زمین (به امر خدا) به غیر این زمین مبدل شود و هم آسمانها دگرگون شوند و تمام خلق در پیشگاه (حکم) خدای یکتای قادر قاهر حاضر شوند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خداوند از کافران و عاصیان انتقام می‌گیرد) در آن روزی که این زمین به زمین دیگری و آسمانها به آسمانهای دیگری تبدیل می‌شوند و آنان (از گورها سر به درآورده و) در پیشگاه خداوندِ یگانه‌ی مسلّط (بر همه‌چیز و همه کس) حضور به هم می‌رسانند (و نیکیها و بدیهای خود را می‌نمایانند). [[«بَرَزُوا»: ظاهر و آشکار می‌گردند و همراه با خوبیها و نیکیهای خود در پهنه صحرای محشر حاضر و آماده می‌شوند (نگا: ابراهیم / 21). «الْقَهَّارِ»: صیغه مبالغه قاهر است. خدائی که بر همه‌چیز و همه‌کس سیطره و تسلّط دارد (نگا: یوسف / 39، رعد / 16).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: روزی که زمین جز این زمین و آسمانها [جز این آسمانها] شوند و همگان در حضور خداوند یگانه قهار آشکار شوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در آن روز که این زمین به زمین دیگر، و آسمانها (به آسمانهای دیگری) مبدل می‌شود، و آنان در پیشگاه خداوند واحد قهار ظاهر می‌گردند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: روزی که دگرگون شود زمین به غیر از زمین و آسمانها و بیایند پیشگاه خداوند یگانه چیرگی‌جوی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [در] روزى كه زمين غير اين زمين گردد و آسمانها [نيز غير اين آسمانها شود]، و [همه‌] در پيشگاه خداى يگانه سخت‌چيره پديدار شوند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: روزی که زمین به غیر (این) زمین و آسمان‌ها به غیر (آن) آسمان‌ها مبدل گردند و (مکلفان) برای خدای یگانه‌ی قهار آشکار شوند؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The day when the earth will he replaced by some other than the earth, as will be the skies, and every one will appear before God the one and omnipotent,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: On the day when the earth will be changed to other than this earth, and the heavens – and they will all come forth standing before Allah, the One, the Dominant above all.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Upon the day the earth shall be changed to other than the earth, and the heavens and they sally forth unto God, the One, the Omnipotent.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: On the Day whereon the earth will be changed into other than the earth, and the heavens also; and all creatures will appear unto Allah, the One, the Subduer.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: On the Day when the earth will be changed to another earth and so will be the heavens, and they (all creatures) will appear before Allah, the One, the Irresistible.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On the Day when the earth is changed into another earth, and the heavens, and they will emerge before God, the One, the Irresistible.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (Do warn them of the) Day when the heavens and the earth shall be altogether changed; when all will appear fully exposed before Allah, the One, the Irresistible!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: On the Day when the earth will be changed to another earth and so will be the heavens, and they (all creatures) will appear before Allah, the One, the Irresistible.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: On the day when the earth will be changed to other than the earth, and the heavens (also will be changed) and they will come forth unto Allah, the One, the Almighty,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The day when the earth is turned into another earth and the heavens [as well], and they are presented before Allah, the One, the All-paramount

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On the Day when the earth is changed into other than the earth and the heavens, all shall come before Allah, the One, the Conqueror.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and all creatures will come out before Allah, the One, the Prevailing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On the day when the earth and the heavens will be replaced by another earth and heavens and everyone will be brought before the One Almighty God,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: On the day when the earth shall be changed into a different earth, and the heavens (as well), and they shall come forth before Allah, the One, the Supreme.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yawma tubaddalu alardu ghayra alardi waalssamawatu wabarazoo lillahi alwahidi alqahhari

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On the Day when the earth shall be changed into another earth, as shall be the heavens, they will all appear before God, the One, the Most Supreme.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: One day the earth will be changed to a different earth, and so will be the heavens, and (men) will be marshalled forth, before Allah, the One, the Irresistible;

verses.text: وَ تَرَى‌ الْمُجْرِمِينَ‌ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُقَرَّنِينَ‌ فِي‌ الْأَصْفَادِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آن روز مجرمان را می بینی که در زنجیرها [به صورتی محکم و سخت] به هم بسته شده اند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مجرمان را در آن روز به غلهايى كه دست را به گردن بندد، بسته بينى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و گناهكاران را در آن روز مى‌بينى كه در زنجيرها بسته شده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و گناهكاران را در آن روز مى‌بينى كه با هم در زنجيرها بسته شده‌اند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (در آن روز) بدکاران را زیر زنجیر (قهر خدا) مشاهده خواهی کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در آن روز گناهکاران را به هم بسته و در غُل و زنجیر خواهی دید. [[«مُقَرَّنِینَ»: به هم بسته شده. هر یک بسته شده به اهریمنی که او را گول زده است (نگا: شعراء / 94، ق / 27). حال مجرمین یا مفعول دوم بشمار است. «الأصْفَادِ»: جمع صَفَد، غُل و زنجیر آهنینی که دست و پای اسیر را با آن می‌بندند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و گناهکاران را بینی که به هم بسته گرفتار بندها هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در آن روز، مجرمان را با هم در غل و زنجیر می‌بینی! (که دستها و گردنهایشان را به هم بسته است!)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بینی گناهکاران را در آن روز بستگان به زنجیرها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و گناهكاران را در آن روز ببينى كه در زنجيرها به هم بسته شده‌اند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و گناهکاران را در آن روز چنان بینی که قرین هم در زنجیرها به سختی بسته شده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You will see the wicked on that day bound together in chains.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And on that day you will see the guilty linked together in chains.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And thou shalt see the sinners that day coupled in fetters,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And thou wilt see the guilty on that Day bound together in fetters.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And you will see the Mujrimun (criminals, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism, polytheists, disobedient to Allah, etc.) that Day bound together in fetters; [Muqarranun in fetters; mean:- with their hands and feet tied to their necks with chains.]

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On that Day, you will see the sinners bound together in chains.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On that Day you shall see the guilty ones secured in chains;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And you will see the criminals that Day, Muqarranun (bound together) in fetters.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thou wilt see the guilty on that day linked together in chains,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —on that day you will see the guilty bound together in chains,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On that Day, you shall see the sinners coupled together in fetters;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: you will see the guilty ones bound in chains,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And you will see the guilty on that day linked together in chains.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Watara almujrimeena yawmaithin muqarraneena fee alasfadi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On that Day you shall see the guilty bound in chains,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And thou wilt see the sinners that day bound together in fetters;-

verses.text: سَرَابِيلُهُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ قَطِرَانٍ‌ وَ تَغْشَى‌ وُجُوهَهُمُ‌ النَّارُ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پیراهن هایشان از قطران [ماده ای متعفّن، قابل اشتعال و بدبو] است، و آتش چهره هایشان را می پوشاند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جامه‌هاشان از قطران است و آتش صورتهاشان را فروپوشيده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: جامه‌هايشان از مس گداخته [يا قير] است و صورت‌هايشان را آتش مى‌پوشاند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تن‌پوشهايشان از «قطران» است و چهره‌هايشان را آتش مى‌پوشاند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (و بینی که) پیراهنهای از مس گداخته آتشین بر تن دارند و در شعله آتش چهره آنها پنهان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پیراهنهای ایشان از قطران است و آتش سر و صورت (و سراپای وجود) آنان را فرا می‌گیرد. [[«سَرَابِیلُ»: جمع سِرْبال، پیراهن (نگا: نحل / 81). «قَطِرَانٍ»: ماده سیاه رنگ و قابل اشتعال و بدبوئی که از نوعی از درختان بادیه بیرون می‌تراود و شبیه قیر است. «سَرَابِیلُهُم مِّن قَطِرَانٍ»: پیراهنشان از قطران است. با قطران آغشته شده‌اند. «وُجُوهَ»: سر و رو. مراد همه پیکر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تن‌پوشهایشان از قطران است و آتش چهره‌هایشان را می‌پوشاند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: لباسهایشان از قطران [= ماده چسبنده بد بوی قابل اشتعال‌] است؛ و صورتهایشان را آتش می‌پوشاند...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جامه‌های ایشان است از قَطران و بپوشد رویهای ایشان را آتش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پيراهنشان از قطِران- مس گداخته يا قير- است و آتش رويهاشان را فرو پوشد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تن‌پوش‌هایشان از ماده‌ای آتشین است و چهره‌هایشان را آتش می‌پوشاند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Of molten pitch shall be their garments, their faces covered with flames,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Their cloaks will be of pitch and fire will cover their faces.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: of pitch their shirts, their faces enveloped by the Fire,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Their trouser hell be of pitch, and the Fire shall cover their faces.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Their garments will be of pitch, and fire will cover their faces.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Their garments made of tar, and the Fire covering their faces.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: their garments shall be black as if made out of pitch, and flames of the Fire shall cover their faces

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Their garments will be of Qatiran (tar), and fire will cover their faces.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Their raiment of pitch, and the Fire covering their faces,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: their garments made of pitch, and the Fire covering their faces,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: their garments shall be of melted tar, and their faces enveloped by the Fire.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered by the Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: with garments of pitch and faces covered by fire.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Their shirts made of pitch and the fire covering their faces

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Sarabeeluhum min qatranin wataghsha wujoohahumu alnnaru

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: their garments shall be of pitch and the fire shall envelop their faces.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Their garments of liquid pitch, and their faces covered with Fire;

verses.text: لِيَجْزِيَ‌ اللَّهُ‌ کُلَ‌ نَفْسٍ‌ مَا کَسَبَتْ‌ إِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ سَرِيعُ‌ الْحِسَابِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: تا [به این کیفیت] خدا هر کس را [به سبب] آنچه انجام داده کیفر دهد؛ یقیناً خدا حسابرسی سریع است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تا خدا هر كس را برابر عملش كيفر دهد، هرآينه خدا سريع الحساب است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تا خدا هر كس را به آنچه انجام داده كيفر دهد. به راستى كه خدا در حساب سريع است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا خدا به هر كس هر چه به دست آورده است جزا دهد، كه خدا زودشمار است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (این گونه عذاب برای آن است) تا خدا هر شخص را به کیفر کردارش برساند، که خدا در یک لحظه به حساب خلق خواهد رسید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این به خاطر آن است که خداوند می‌خواهد هرکس را مطابق آنچه انجام داده است سزا و جزا دهد. خداوند حسابرس تند و سریعی است. [[«لِیَجْزِیَ اللهُ ...»: تا این که با این نوع حضور و این قسم لباس، خداوند برابر آنچه کرده‌اند سزایشان دهد. این اعمال بد ایشان است که با تغییر چهره به سراغ آنان می‌آید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تا بدین‌سان خداوند هر کسی را، بر وفق آنچه کرده است، پاداش دهد، چرا که خداوند زودشمار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تا خداوند هر کس را، هر آنچه انجام داده، جزا دهد! به یقین، خداوند سریع الحساب است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا پاداش دهد خدا به هر کس آنچه فراهم آورده است و همانا خداوند است شتابنده در حساب‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تا خداوند هر كس را سزاى آنچه كرده است بدهد، كه خدا زود حساب است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: برای اینکه خدا به هر کس هر چه را به دست آورده است، پاداش دهد. به‌راستی خدا زودشمار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That God may reward each soul for its deeds. Indeed God is swift at reckoning!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In order that Allah may repay each soul what it had earned; indeed Allah spends no time in judging the account.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: that God may recompense every soul for its earnings; surely God is swift at the reckoning.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: That Allah may requite each soul according to that which he hath earned: verily Allah is swift in reckoning.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: That Allah may requite each person according to what he has earned. Truly, Allah is Swift at reckoning.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: That God may repay each soul according to what it has earned. God is Quick in reckoning.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: so that Allah may requite each person for his deeds. Allah is swift in reckoning.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: That Allah may requite each person according to what he has earned. Truly, Allah is swift at reckoning.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That Allah may repay each soul what it hath earned. Lo! Allah is swift at reckoning.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: so that Allah may reward every soul for what it has earned. Indeed Allah is swift at reckoning.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Allah will recompense each soul according to its earnings. Swift is the Reckoning of Allah.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So that Allah will recompense every soul for what it earned. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This is how God will recompense each soul for its deeds. God's reckoning is swift.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: That Allah may requite each soul (according to) what it has earned; surely Allah is swift in reckoning.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Liyajziya Allahu kulla nafsin ma kasabat inna Allaha sareeAAu alhisabi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God will requite each soul according to its deeds. Swift is God's reckoning.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That Allah may requite each soul according to its deserts; and verily Allah is swift in calling to account.

verses.text: هٰذَا بَلاَغٌ‌ لِلنَّاسِ‌ وَ لِيُنْذَرُوا بِهِ‌ وَ لِيَعْلَمُوا أَنَّمَا هُوَ إِلٰهٌ‌ وَاحِدٌ وَ لِيَذَّکَّرَ أُولُوا الْأَلْبَابِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این [قرآن یا آنچه در این سوره است] پیامی برای [همه] مردم است، برای آنکه به وسیله آن هشدار داده شوند، و [با تدبّر در آیاتش] بدانند که او معبودی یگانه و یکتاست، و تا خردمندان، متذکّر [حقایق و معارف الهیّه] شوند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اين پيامى است براى مردم، تا بدان بيمناك شوند و بدانند كه اوست خداى يكتا، و تا خردمندان پند گيرند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اين [قرآن‌] پيامى روشنى براى مردم است، و براى اين كه بدان انذار شوند و بدانند كه تنها او معبود يگانه است، و تا صاحبان خرد پند گيرند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اين [قرآن‌] ابلاغى براى مردم است [تا به وسيله آن هدايت شوند] و بدان بيم يابند و بدانند كه او معبودى يگانه است، و تا صاحبان خرد پند گيرند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این (قرآن عظیم) حجت بالغ برای جمیع مردم است (تا خلایق از آن پند گرفته) و تا بدان وسیله خداشناس و خداترس شوند و تا عموم بشر خدا را به یگانگی بشناسند و صاحبان عقل، متذکر و هوشیار گردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این (قرآن) به عموم مردم ابلاغ می‌گردد تا بدان ترسانده شوند و بدانند که خداوند یکی بیش نیست، و خردمندان (از خواندن قرآن) پند و اندرز گیرند (و خویشتن را در پرتو آن از آتش دوزخ دور کنند و به بهشت برسانند). [[«هذَا»: این آیه‌ها، یعنی از 42 تا آخر سوره. این قرآن ... «بَلاغٌ»: تبلیغ. ابلاغ. کفایت می‌کند. «هَذَا بَلاغٌ لِّلنَّاسِ»: این ابلاغ به همه مردم است. این برای همه مردمان کافی و بسنده است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: این پند و پیامی برای مردم است، تا به آن هشدار یابند و بدانند که او خدای یگانه است و تا خردمندان پند گیرند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این (قرآن،) پیام (و ابلاغی) برای (عموم) مردم است؛ تا همه به وسیله آن انذار شوند، و بدانند او خدا یکتاست؛ و تا صاحبان مغز (و اندیشه) پند گیرند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: این است آگهیی برای مردم و تا بیم داده شوند بدان و تا بدانند همانا او خداوندی است یکتا و تا یادآور شوند خداوندان خردها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اين براى مردم پيامى رسا و بسنده است [تا بدان پند داده شوند] و تا بدان بيم كرده شوند و بدانند كه او خداى يگانه است و تا خردمندان ياد كنند و پند گيرند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: این (قرآن) برای مردمان بلاغ و رسایی‌ای (وحیانی) است و تا بدان هشدار داده شوند و بدانند که خدا بی‌گمان معبودی یگانه است و تا اندیشمندان پندی بزرگ گیرند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: This is a message for mankind that they may take a warning from it, and may know that He is the one and only God, and that men of wisdom may reflect.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: This is the message to be conveyed to all mankind – and in order to warn them with it, and for them to know that He is the only One God, and for men of understanding to heed advice.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: This is a Message to be delivered to mankind that they may be warned by it, and that they may know that He is One God, and that all possessed of minds may remember.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: This is a preaching for mankind, and that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that there is only one God, and that the men of understanding may be admonished.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: This (Quran) is a Message for mankind (and a clear proof against them), in order that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that He is the only One Ilah (God - Allah) - (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah), and that men of understanding may take heed.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: This is a proclamation for mankind, that they may be warned thereby, and know that He is One God, and that people of understanding may remember.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: This is a proclamation for all mankind that they may be warned by it, and that they may know that their God is none but the One True God, and that men of understanding may take heed.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: This (Qur'an) is a Message for mankind (and a clear proof against them), in order that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that He is the only One God and that men of understanding may take heed.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: This is a clear message for mankind in order that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that He is only One Allah, and that men of understanding may take heed.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: This is a proclamation for mankind, so that they may be warned thereby and know that He is indeed the One God, and those who possess intellect may take admonition.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: This is a message to be delivered to mankind so that they may be warned by it, and know that He is (Allah) One God, and so all those possessed of minds may remember.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: This [Qur'an] is notification for the people that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but one God and that those of understanding will be reminded.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This is an admonition for the people that they will be warned and know that He is the only God, and so that the people of understanding may take heed.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: This is a sufficient exposition for the people and that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that He is One Allah and that those possessed of understanding may mind.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Hatha balaghun lilnnasi waliyuntharoo bihi waliyaAAlamoo annama huwa ilahun wahidun waliyaththakkara oloo alalbabi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: This is a message for mankind. Let them take warning from it and know that He is but one God. Let those possessed of understanding may take heed.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Here is a Message for mankind: Let them take warning therefrom, and let them know that He is (no other than) One Allah: let men of understanding take heed.
